adjectives.description: unkindly (comparative more unkindly, superlative most unkindly)

entries.meaning: Not kind, lacking in friendliness, warm-heartedness or sympathy.
examples: […]  she had seen a not unkindly wink pass between the two.
From this superfluous pulp in unkindely, and wet years, may arise that multiplicity of little insects, which infest the Roots and Sprouts of tender Graines and pulses.

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Unnatural, contrary to the natural or proper order of things.
examples: […]  the want of mercy in a Father, is more unkindly, more unseemly, more unnatural than in another man  […]

adverbs.description: unkindly (comparative more unkindly, superlative most unkindly)

examples: Chester and Prideaux were dragged firmly but not unkindly down the stairs and out through the door.
